title: Tuesday's Equity Market Losses Reverse
text:
After Tuesday's losses, yesterday it was the turn of moving averages to step in as support. Action for the last couple of days does look like washout trading to shake out weak-holding longs

The suffered the most on Tuesday but did well to attract buyers yesterday at its converged 50-day and 20-day MAs. While yesterday's buying was good, it wasn't enough to prevent a MACD trigger 'sell'.

RUT Daily Chart

The recovered from Tuesday's loss of its 20-day and 50-day MAs with a bullish piercing pattern. However, like the , it couldn't escape the MACD trigger 'sell.' It also has more bearish technicals, although price action remains good.

COMPQ Daily Chart

The also had a strong day yesterday, but it came close to invalidating the breakout gap. It really needs to push on if it's not to lose momentum, particularly as the MACD, CCI and ADX have turned bearish.

SOX Daily Chart

Not to be outdone, the rallied off its 50-day MA but couldn't avoid its own MACD trigger 'sell'.

SPX Daily Chart

It's a similar picture for the , although it too has a MACD and ADX 'sell' trigger to contend with.

INDU Daily Chart

Bullish traders will need to push yesterday's gains if expanding technical weakness is not to take root and swing Algo traders into bearish strategies—pressuring bull traders' positions.
description: Stocks Analysis by Declan Fallon covering: S&P 500, Dow Jones Industrial Average, US SmallCap 2000, NASDAQ Composite. Read Declan Fallon's latest article on Investing.com
